Text.Value: I'll decide whether to make a fuss or not. Hard to trust someone who's holding out on me.
You were just about to loot this shrine - don't pretend you're offended now.
Gather your thoughts. Then perhaps we can talk some more.
I should've just stayed quiet. You want the truth? Fine.
The goddess of secrets? How telling.
You worship Shar? Blimey. She and my beloved Mystra are not exactly friends.
There's more. Use your parasite and enter her thoughts. Look for what she's hiding.
I'll do as I please. If you want to try stopping me, be my guest.
You could have told me. How long were you going to keep this secret?
Don't thank me - I'm breaking Lady Shar's teachings just by doing so... but sometimes you have to be practical.

EditorData.NodeContext: A little embarassed at being thanked

Text.Value: We can discuss this later. But let's just try a little more honesty going forward.
Now that the truth's out, tell me more.
If it matters that much to you, I'll leave it.
It's been some time since I met another faithful of Shar. Are you versed in her teachings?
Watch your mouth, Sharran. That's twice you've spoken ill of my goddess.
Agh - I can feel you, idiot. Keep out of my skull or I'll break yours open.
I'll do as I please. If you want to try stop me, be my guest.
*She's repelled by the Selûnite relics. They are an offence to her goddess - Shar.*
*But would Shar agree? Would she see it as accepting Selûnite gifts? Difficult to say.*
I can't trust you. Best if we travel separately for now.
Don't make a fuss, Selûnite - we may be at odds, but I have more important concerns than you right now.
*But would Shar agree? Would she see it as accepting Selûnite gifts? Difficult to say.*
Talk to me later. We've got more pressing matters to see to right now.
I worship Shar, Mistress of the Night - Selûne's twin and foe.
That's my patron goddess you're besmirching. Watch your mouth, Sharran.
Take them if you must. But I'll remember you didn't listen to sense.
I'm not sorry I kept this from you. Not one bit.
These are offerings to Selûne. I won't destroy them.
Spare me the indignity - you looked set to loot this sad little shrine.
Taking them is the pragmatic choice.
Your blindness as much as my deception, Selûnite. We can talk about this later - if you're willing.
Secrecy is everything for Shar's children. It's our code, our creed, our shield.
Though perhaps that might change, if you can show an open mind.

EditorData.NodeContext: Conceding jus a little towards the player's hurt feelings - but conditionally

Text.Value: Who says you have to feel anything?
In future, I expect you to be honest. Let's leave it at that for now.
You should leave it. Or even destroy it, if possible.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Companion Origin is speaker 1, Avatar is speaker 2

Text.Value: But... why?
I don't care who you worship. We have bigger problems.
I bow to Shar also. The Dark Lady must favour us, to have brought us together.
*You look at the Selûnite offerings. Nothing but profane baubles.*
Don't be ridiculous - there could be something useful here.
Do not trifle with that moon witch or her trinkets. Only trouble will follow.
True. I didn't think you'd react so pragmatically. Perhaps I should have told you sooner.
I do. Thank you for understanding.
Shar is an abomination. You deceived me.
Gladly.
You're hiding something. You worship Shar, don't you?
I don't know how I feel about this.
Good.
Fantastic. Monsters in our minds, and around our campfire.
I didn't agree to join up with a Shar worshipper.
I... yes, she must. I'll offer thanks to her in my prayers - and we should speak more later. Alone, ideally.
Fine. Perhaps you can sell them for a couple of coins.
Of course I am. But we can talk about this later - let's go.
We can't just abandon resources that we might need. Be sensible.
It does. Thank you.
*Still, they could be traded for something valuable.*
... I should have been more discreet around you, clearly. Yes, you're right.
If you insist.
This rubbish is an offering to Selûne. At best, it's worthless. At worst... who knows? Could be cursed.
Then it's your own fault for not asking.
I almost pity her, if you're the quality of follower she attracts.
Forever, ideally. And you assume too much about what I can and cannot tell.
I decide what gods I heed. Not you.
A lie of omission at most. I'm sure you have some skeletons of your own hidden away.

RuleGroup.RuleString: CLERIC_EVIL or CLERIC_SHAR or PALADIN_EVIL or PALADIN_SHAR

Text.Value: No, this is perfect. You get to spite Selûne by stealing gifts meant for her.
But you'll steal them? An interesting way to show your devotion.
I even keep secrets from myself - I had my memories suppressed, so that nothing I knew could be used against the Dark Lady. Once I prove myself, my memories will be restored.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This node only if the memory suppression beat wasn't established

Text.Value: That's twice you've spoken ill of my goddess. Watch your mouth.
Thank you for telling me, at least.
*You look at the Selûnite offerings. Nothing but profane baubles.*
We're in no position to abandon resources. I'm sure Shar will understand.
All we can do is try, I suppose...
*Still, they could be traded for something valuable.*
Trifling with that moon witch will only bring you trouble. Shar's guidance is clear.
That's my patron goddess you're besmirching. Watch your mouth.
*But would Shar agree? She may be pleased to see offerings to Selûne stolen. Difficult to say.*
If you insist. Don't expect to fare well without me to save you.
Don't make a big fuss...? You've been lying to me!
Why do you care so much?
To even touch that filth would be to dishonour Shar.
Heavens forbid. We're all entitled to our secrets.
I never knew Selûne's followers were quite so wretched. Do as you please.
Because we've enough troubles and burdens as it is. Common sense, that's all.
A Shar worshipper? Not my usual quarry - nor my usual ally.
Let's see how open-minded I can be then: tell me more.
Now that you have the truth, please don't make a big fuss about it.

Synopsis: Shadowheart reacts to taking offerings made at a shrine to Selûne, the rival of her goddess Shar. If Shadowheart is the avatar, she has a moment of introspection where she considers if she should take the items of not. If Shadowheart is a companion, she encourages the player to not take the items. The player can try talk her around, and may discover she is a Shar worshipper if they don't already know. The outcome of this dialogue potentially strengthens or damages Shadowheart's opinion of the player.
